metadata.title: CVE-2021-4095 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
A NULL pointer dereference was found in the Linux kernel's KVM when dirtyring logging is enabled without an active vCPU context. An unprivilegedlocal attacker on the host may use this flaw to cause a kernel oopscondition and thus a denial of service by issuing a KVM_XEN_HVM_SET_ATTRioctl. This flaw affects Linux kernel versions prior to 5.17-rc1.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-4095` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.5.0-9-generic - 5.19.0-21.21
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-generic - 5.19.0-21.21
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-generic-64k - 5.19.0-21.21
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1008-aws - 5.19.0-1009.9
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1007-azure - 5.19.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1007-gcp - 5.19.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1009-ibm - 5.19.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1010-oracle - 5.19.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-6.5.0-1005-raspi - 5.19.0-1004.10
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-lowlatency - 5.19.0-1007.7
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-lowlatency-64k - 5.19.0-1007.7
No subscription required
